brandcolor-primary.usage: Main CTA button background, primary brand color

brandcolor-primaryhover.usage: Hover state for primary buttons (when background is primary)
whenToUse: Hover on elements with primary background
examples: Full primary button: bg-brandcolor-primary text-brandcolor-white hover:bg-brandcolor-primaryhover
brandcolor-primaryhover.logic: When a button or element has bg-brandcolor-primary, the hover should use bg-brandcolor-primaryhover (darker shade of primary)

brandcolor-secondary.usage: Secondary brand color for outline/secondary buttons with border
examples: Outline button: border-brandcolor-secondary text-brandcolor-secondary bg-transparent hover:bg-brandcolor-neutralhover

brandcolor-secondaryfill.usage: Brand color secondary fill â€“ active/selected state background (e.g. Natural language dropdown when open)
whenToUse: Active state of secondary-related controls (e.g. search type dropdown when open)
Selected pill/badge backgrounds tied to secondary actions
Light fill where secondary (#2F55D9) is the accent

brandcolor-secondaryhover.usage: Hover state for secondary buttons (darker shade of secondary)
whenToUse: Hover on elements with secondary background
brandcolor-secondaryhover.logic: When a button has secondary background color, the hover should use bg-brandcolor-secondaryhover (#183885) which is a darker shade of secondary for better visual feedback.

brandcolor-neutralhover.usage: Hover state for neutral buttons and outline buttons (NOT bg-brandcolor-fill)
whenToUse: Hover on elements with neutral/outline style
brandcolor-neutralhover.logic: When a button is neutral or outline style (with border), the hover should use bg-brandcolor-neutralhover (#EFEFEF), NOT bg-brandcolor-fill.

brandcolor-textstrong.usage: Headings, main headings, button text in some cases

brandcolor-textweak.usage: Secondary text, secondary hierarchy after main text

brandcolor-strokestrong.usage: ALWAYS use for: Sidebar borders, input field borders, button borders, icons
brandcolor-strokestrong.importantNote: ALWAYS use strokestrong for sidebar borders, input field borders, and button borders. This is a mandatory rule.

brandcolor-strokeweak.usage: ALWAYS use for: Card borders, dividers, and all other light elements
whenToUse: Secondary button borders (ALL secondary buttons use this border color - exception to button border rule)
brandcolor-strokeweak.importantNote: ALWAYS use strokeweak for card borders and dividers. Secondary buttons are an exception and also use strokeweak.

brandcolor-strokemild.usage: ALWAYS use for: Table row borders when hovered
whenToUse: Table row borders when row is hovered (hover:border-brandcolor-strokemild)

brandcolor-strokelight.usage: ALWAYS use for: Primary-outline button borders
whenToUse: Light stroke borders for primary-outline buttons

brandcolor-fill.usage: Layout background (NOT for neutral/outline button hover - use brandcolor-neutralhover instead)
brandcolor-fill.importantNote: DO NOT use this for neutral/outline button hover - use brandcolor-neutralhover (#EFEFEF) instead

brandcolor-white.usage: Background color in general wherever necessary

brandcolor-page-bg.usage: Main content area / page background (warm off-white)
whenToUse: Home page main content area background
examples: Page layout: bg-brandcolor-page-bg on main content container

brandcolor-surface.usage: Light gray surface for page background and cards
examples: HomePage: bg-brandcolor-surface on page root and scroll container

brandcolor-sidebarhover.usage: Hover state background color for sidebar menu items and dropdown menu backgrounds

brandcolor-banner-warning-bg.usage: Background color for warning / alert banners

brandcolor-banner-warning-button.usage: Button background color for warning banners

brandcolor-results-bg.usage: Background color for results layout and scrollable content areas

brandcolor-archived-badge.usage: Background for 'Archived' badge/label on archived cards

brandcolor-badge-attorney-text.usage: Attorney/entity card badge icon and label color (dark purple)

brandcolor-badge-amber-text.usage: Amber entity card badge icon and label color

cornerRadius.description: ALL buttons MUST have 6px corner radius. Use rounded-button (from theme) or rounded-md.

secondaryBorderWidth.description: ALL secondary buttons MUST have 1.5px border width.

primary.completeClasses: border-[1.5px] border-transparent bg-brandcolor-primary text-brandcolor-white hover:bg-brandcolor-primaryhover focus:border-brandcolor-primary active:border-brandcolor-primary active:shadow-button-press disabled:opacity-50 rounded-button
primary.whenToUse: Main call-to-action buttons with primary brand color

secondary.completeClasses: border-[1.5px] border-transparent bg-brandcolor-secondary text-brandcolor-white hover:bg-brandcolor-secondaryhover focus:border-brandcolor-secondary active:border-brandcolor-secondary active:shadow-button-press disabled:opacity-50 rounded-button
secondary.whenToUse: Secondary call-to-action buttons with secondary brand color background

secondary-outline.completeClasses: shadow-border-inset-strokelight text-brandcolor-secondary bg-brandcolor-white hover:bg-brandcolor-neutralhover active:shadow-border-inset-secondary-press disabled:opacity-50 rounded-button
secondary-outline.whenToUse: Secondary button style with outline appearance (white background with secondary border and text). Border is INSIDE (inset).

neutral.completeClasses: border-[1.5px] border-brandcolor-strokelight text-brandcolor-textweak bg-brandcolor-white hover:bg-brandcolor-neutralhover active:border-brandcolor-textweak active:shadow-button-press disabled:opacity-50 rounded-button
neutral.whenToUse: Neutral actions that don't require primary or secondary emphasis

primary-outline.completeClasses: border-[1.5px] border-brandcolor-strokelight text-brandcolor-primary bg-brandcolor-white hover:bg-brandcolor-neutralhover active:border-brandcolor-primary active:shadow-button-press disabled:opacity-50 rounded-button
primary-outline.whenToUse: Primary button style with outline appearance (white background with primary border and text). Border is CENTERED.

criticalRules: ALL buttons MUST have rounded-button (6px) - NO EXCEPTIONS
Primary-outline uses CENTERED border; secondary-outline uses INSET border (shadow)
Never use hardcoded Tailwind colors; only theme utility classes
ALWAYS use border-brandcolor-strokeweak for card borders
Card width MUST be dynamic (w-fit or inline-block), NEVER fixed w-full for content cards
Body: text-brandcolor-textstrong for regular text, text-brandcolor-secondary for clickable/links

workflow: STEP 1 (MANDATORY): Read src/app/theme.css to see theme variables (Tailwind v4)
STEP 2 (MANDATORY): Read this theme-guide.json COMPLETELY to understand all rules
STEP 3: Check componentGuidelines for the specific component you are creating
STEP 4: Generate code using ONLY theme utility classes (bg-brandcolor-*, text-brandcolor-*, border-brandcolor-*, etc.)
STEP 5: Follow componentGuidelines exactly (requiredClasses, cornerRadius, etc.)
STEP 6: Verify no hex codes, no inline styles, no hardcoded Tailwind colors (e.g. bg-blue-*, text-gray-*)

mandatoryFirstStep.rule: BEFORE making any component or styling changes, you MUST: (1) Read src/app/theme.css for theme tokens, (2) Read theme-guide.json completely for usage and component rules

criticalRules.noHexCodes: NEVER use hex color codes (#008B31, #2F55D9, etc.) in HTML, CSS, or inline styles
criticalRules.noInlineStyles: NEVER use inline styles for colors; use Tailwind utility classes only
criticalRules.noHardcodedTailwindColors: NEVER use bg-blue-*, text-gray-*, border-gray-* etc.; use bg-brandcolor-*, text-brandcolor-*, border-brandcolor-*
criticalRules.onlyThemeClasses: All color classes MUST use the theme: bg-brandcolor-*, text-brandcolor-*, border-brandcolor-*

validationChecklist: NO inline style attributes for colors
